H0.text: What is the name of the document issued, by law, giving information about a company to be floated on a stock exchange. Offering Circular

H1.text: What is the name of the document issued, by law, giving information about a company to be floated on a stock exchange. Stock Exchange Memorandum

H2.text: What is the name of the document issued, by law, giving information about a company to be floated on a stock exchange. Company Profile

H3.text: What is the name of the document issued, by law, giving information about a company to be floated on a stock exchange. Prospectus

A4.text: In a securities offering in the United States, a prospectus is required to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) as part of a registration statement.

A5.text: The prospectus must be approved by the competent authority in the United Kingdom, which is currently the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) in its capacity as the United Kingdom Listing Authority.
